Side Effects: no menstruation_ occasional to frequent spotting_ occasional random cramps_ possible slight weight gain in midsection (or am i just getting older?)
Comments: I am also on Yaz_ where I take only the pills with the hormones (pink pills) and just throw away the placebos (white pills) and start the next month's pack.  I started this  at the same time as Danazol_ so it is difficult to decipher what effects are from which drug... but overall I am very happy with my current drug situation.  I was on Lupron for a year after my initial diagnosis and first surgery - it was HORRIBLE.  I gained almost 20 lbs and had crazy hot flashes all the time.  Went off Lupron_ was not on anything for 3 years_ and my periods were much shorter than they had been before_ and I'd usually only have cramps for 1 day_ managable through advil.  Then they found an 8 cm mass doing an mri for something else_ and I had surgery to remove the mass and my left ovary_ which had been consumed by endometrial tissue.  I am taking Danazol and Yaz now - *the spotting is better/less frequent if I take the drugs at almost exactly the same time every day and night.  I might have had a sl

Side Effects: No more periods_ MAJOR mood swings_ some acne_ water retention_ weight gain
Comments: Helps with swelling in my hands and feet. Doesn't help with my stomach swelling. Still getting weekly stomach attacks on 200mg daily.

Side Effects: cannot stop menstrating_ oily skin_ weight gain_ leg swelling_ blurred vision_ and tiredness.
Comments: i have not had an attack!! yipee! but i am blind_ fat_ greasy_ and bloody. boo!!

Side Effects: Excessive hair growth in unwanted parts_ shrinkage in breast size.
Comments: I have taken 100mg og Danazol almost everyday for 15 years (well over the recomended time) but I couldn't live without it.My breast pain was so severe I couldn't roll over in bed or even walk around without being in agony_ so the good things far out way the bad_ it changed my life !!

Side Effects: Oily skin_ acne_ voice change_ increased "bad cholesterol" & decreased "good cholesterol"_ muscle cramps.
Comments: It worked wonders for the endometriosis pain without causing any really bothersome side effects (except for debilitating muscle cramps during the first 4 months of use). No mood swings or sleep disturbances as with many other hormonal treatments. If my voice hadn't started to sound like a man's and my cholesterol levels hadn't become unhealthy I would most definetely have continued taking it. Bit of a bummer: pain returned almost immediately after discontinuing use. I was using a very low dose: 300 mg per day.

Side Effects: Just started taking this a couple of days ago.  Not sure if it's helped.  Just nasea mainly.
Comments: If anyone else has any comments_ I'd love to see them.
